meanings.definition: Convert (an image or graphic) into a vector format.
meanings.sent1: She was vectorising the logo to make it scalable.
meanings.sent2: The designer spent hours vectorising the illustration for better quality.
meanings.sent3: While vectorising the photo, she accidentally turned her friend into a cartoon.
meanings.sent4: His skill in vectorising images was like turning sketches into professional artwork.
meanings.sent5: The process of vectorising transformed the pixelated image into a smooth graphic.

meanings.definition: Transform (data) into a vector form for processing.
meanings.sent1: The scientist was vectorising the data to analyze it more efficiently.
meanings.sent2: Vectorising the information helped in simplifying the complex dataset.
meanings.sent3: By vectorising the numbers, he made the spreadsheet look like a colorful graph.
meanings.sent4: The act of vectorising the data was like converting scattered puzzle pieces into a clear picture.
meanings.sent5: She found joy in vectorising the statistics, making them easier to comprehend.

meanings.definition: To create or manipulate vectors in a computer program.
meanings.sent1: The programmer was vectorising the shapes to enhance the game graphics.
meanings.sent2: Vectorising the elements allowed for smoother animation in the software.
meanings.sent3: While vectorising the lines, he accidentally created a geometric masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her talent in vectorising vectors was like sculpting digital sculptures.
meanings.sent5: The process of vectorising vectors made the program run more efficiently.
